title: Understanding React Hooks
content: React Hooks allow you to use state and other React features without writing a class. In this blog post, we'll explore the basics of useState, useEffect, and other commonly used hooks.
author: Jane Doe

title: Getting Started with Tailwind CSS
content: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build custom designs. This post will guide you through setting up Tailwind CSS in your project and using its classes to style your components.
author: John Smith

title: Next.js: Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation
content: Next.js offers two main methods for rendering pages: server-side rendering (SSR) and static generation (SG). In this post, we will compare these two approaches and help you choose the best one for your application.
author: Alice Johnson

title: A Guide to Modern JavaScript Features
content: Modern JavaScript introduces new features and syntax improvements that enhance development experience. This guide covers ES6+ features like arrow functions, destructuring, and async/await.
author: Bob Brown
